rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures no public/anonymous user can reach internal systems via the chatbot or APIs.
rules.compact_rule: IF user.is_authenticated_employee == false THEN DENY ALL_ACCESS to {CRM, ProjectRegistry, EmployeeRegistry, TimeTracking, InternalWiki, ChatbotInterface}; Outcome = 'denied_security'.

rules.why_relevant_summary: All chatbot/API access must be tied to a known employee identity with roles for correct permission checks.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ALL system_access_via_chatbot: REQUIRE user.account_mapped_to_employee_id AND user.department AND user.location AND user.system_roles; USE THESE for authorization_decisions.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines what profile data any employee can see about any other employee via the chatbot.
rules.compact_rule: IF caller.is_employee THEN ALLOW READ employee.{name, email, location, department, basic_role, context-appropriate_skills_wills_subset}; DISALLOW access to confidential_fields BY DEFAULT.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Restricts full employee profile (including salary and HR notes) to HR and managers only.
rules.compact_rule: IF requested_fields ∩ {salary, hr_notes, full_skill_will_history} != ∅ THEN REQUIRE caller.role IN {'HRAdmin','HRUser','DirectManagerOf(target_employee)','ExecWithHRDelegation'} ELSE Outcome='denied_security'.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents leakage of salary information through the chatbot/API, as illustrated by the example salary query.
rules.compact_rule: ON query LIKE 'what is <employee>.salary?': IF caller.role NOT IN {'HRAdmin','HRUser','DirectManagerOf(employee)','ExecWithHRDelegation'} THEN Outcome='denied_security' AND DO_NOT_RETURN salary_value.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents storage or generation of sensitive personal data (e.g. salaries) inside the wiki via automated agents.
rules.compact_rule: KnowledgeBasePolicy: DO_NOT_STORE sensitive_personal_data (e.g. individual salaries) IN wiki_pages; AI_agent.MUST_NOT_CREATE_OR_UPDATE wiki_content that embeds such data.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Enforces role-based access control for all systems, including when accessed via AI/automation.
rules.compact_rule: ACCESS_CONTROL: GRANT access_to_system(S) ONLY_IF caller.system_roles CONTAINS role_required_by(S, operation); IT_central + HR define and manage role_assignments; AI_agent MUST HONOUR same role checks.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Chatbot write operations (mutations) must be protected by permission checks, not only reads.
rules.compact_rule: FOR ANY chatbot_action IN {UpdateEmployeeInfo, UpdateProjectTeam, UpdateProjectStatus, CreateTimeEntry, UpdateTimeEntry}: BEFORE_EXECUTE REQUIRE authorize(caller, action, target); IF NOT authorized THEN Outcome='denied_security' AND NO_STATE_CHANGE.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Controls which parts of an employee’s own profile they can update via chatbot/API.
rules.compact_rule: IF caller.employee_id == target_employee_id THEN ALLOW UPDATE of {skills, wills, possibly_location_per_policy} VIA chatbot; DISALLOW self-update of {salary, department, manager, HR_notes} (HR/Managers only).

rules.why_relevant_summary: Location changes via chatbot may require HR policy checks; AI must not bypass them.
rules.compact_rule: ON action == ChangeEmployeeLocation: IF policy.requires_HR_approval OR caller != target_employee THEN REQUIRE caller.role IN {'HRAdmin','HRUser'} ELSE Outcome='denied_security'; ELSE allow_self_service_update.

rules.why_relevant_summary: All employee registry changes must be auditable, including those initiated by AI agents.
rules.compact_rule: FOR EACH change TO EmployeeRegistry: RECORD audit_entry{changed_by = caller.employee_id_or_service_id, timestamp, fields_changed}; AI_agent MUST PASS THROUGH caller_identity for correct auditing.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures immutable approved time entries and preserves audit trail when AI handles corrections.
rules.compact_rule: TimeEntryMutationRules: IF time_entry.status IN {'approved','invoiced'} THEN DISALLOW direct_edit_by_employee; REQUIRE correction_process (e.g. void + new_entry) with audit; chatbot/API MUST ENFORCE same constraint.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Prevents project leads (or AI acting for them) from improperly submitting other people’s time.
rules.compact_rule: IF caller.role == 'ProjectLead' THEN ALLOW create_or_edit time_entry.status='draft' FOR team_members; DISALLOW setting status ∈ {'submitted','approved','invoiced'} FOR other_employees' entries.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Defines how the chatbot should signal security denials and avoid partial data leaks.
rules.compact_rule: ON authorization_failure: SET Outcome='denied_security'; RETURN generic_explanation_without_sensitive_details; DO_NOT_RETURN any part of denied_payload (even if subset non-sensitive).

rules.why_relevant_summary: For all live operational data, the AI agent must use the designated system of record instead of ad-hoc or cached data.
rules.compact_rule: SYSTEM_OF_RECORD: FOR customer_data USE CRM; FOR project_and_workload USE ProjectRegistry; FOR employee_profiles USE EmployeeRegistry; FOR time_entries USE TimeTracking; AI_agent MUST NOT create_or_use 'shadow' entities outside these systems.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Distinguishes between wiki (process/knowledge) and transactional systems so AI doesn’t write or read live business data from the wrong place.
rules.compact_rule: DO_NOT treat wiki AS transactional_source; USE wiki ONLY FOR {processes, guidelines, reference}; FOR current statuses, numbers, or master_data ALWAYS query appropriate core_system via API.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Controls what the chatbot can disclose about customers/projects/time; assumes internal-only but still scoped by job needs.
rules.compact_rule: IF caller.is_employee THEN ALLOW READ-ONLY queries on {customers, projects, time_summaries} SUBJECT TO role-based scoping (e.g. sensitive financials restricted); AI_agent MUST APPLY same scope filters as existing UIs.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Ensures workload and time data are used for planning and analytics only, without exposing extra confidential info.
rules.compact_rule: WHEN answering workload_or_time_reports VIA chatbot: USE aggregated_time_slices (from ProjectRegistry) and time_entries; DO NOT expose hidden_fields (e.g. individual billing_rates) unless caller is authorized_finance_role.

rules.why_relevant_summary: Clarifies that the internal chatbot is for employees, not a public bot; AI-integrated APIs must assume an internal, authenticated context only.
rules.compact_rule: ChatbotScope: chatbot_interface IS_DESIGNED_FOR employees_only; DO_NOT EXPOSE chatbot_or_underlying_APIs directly_to_public_internet_without_separate_auth_layer; unauthenticated_public_chatbots MUST act only on non-sensitive public info.
